title: Open Data for Development supported ODI Summit tickets

details.description: The ODI, supported by the Open Data for Development (OD4D) Network, will be awarding a selection of partially and fully funded bursaries for individuals working towards advancing open data for development to attend the ODI Summit and ODI Summit Training Discovery Day on 2-3 November 2015.
details.content:
The ODI, supported by the Open Data for Development (OD4D) Network, will be awarding a selection of partially and fully funded bursaries for individuals working towards advancing open data for development to attend the ODI Summit and ODI Summit Training Discovery Day on 2-3 November 2015.

The OD4D program is managed by Canada’s International Development Research Centre (IDRC), and it is a donor partnership with the World Bank, United Kingdom’s Department for International Development (DFID), and Canada's Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade, and Development (DFATD).

The theme for this year’s ODI Summit is ‘Generation Open’: global citizens who embrace network thinking and open culture. It will showcase innovation and excellence in open data from around the world with from Sir Tim Berners-Lee, Martha Lane Fox, Neelie Kroes and Sir Nigel Shadbolt and experts from business, government, the arts, startups and charities.

What we’re offering:

  • up to 10 partially funded places to the ODI Summit 2015 and Training Discovery Day (tickets only to both events only).
  • up to 10 fully funded places at the ODI Summit 2015 and Training Discovery Day (includes tickets to both events, with up to £1,500 support for travel and accommodation).

The judging criteria is available on request, strong applicants will:

  • demonstrate how their work relates to the OD4D Network goals
  • the impact that attending the ODI Summit 2015 would have on them and their work.

Priority will be given to those from or working in developing countries.

Download the application form.

Key dates and criteria:

  • Application closes on 19 October 2015, 9AM BST
  • Successful applicants will be notified on 20 October 2015
  • Awarded individuals will attend the ODI Training Discovery Day on 2 November 2015 and Summit 2015 on 3 November 2015

Please read our terms and conditions before applying.

For further information or questions, please contact dawn.duhaney@theodi.org
